purpose.summary: This policy establishes standard payment timing for all sales incentive compensation to ensure compliance with state wage payment laws, consistent participant experience, adequate time for calculation and validation, alignment with payroll cycles, and financial planning and accrual accuracy.
objectives: Compliance with state wage payment laws
Adequate time for calculation and validation

appliesTo: All sales incentive compensation payments across all divisions and plans

definitions.definition: The 5th business day of the month following the performance period, by which all sales must be finalized in source systems (CRM, ERP). Finance validates revenue data and Sales Operations locks data for calculation.

The minimum amount ($50) per payment period below which payments are carried forward to next period. Paid annually if cumulative amount remains below threshold. Paid upon termination regardless of amount.

provisions.title: Payment Frequency Standards
provisions.content: Standard payment frequencies based on plan type.

subProvisions.title: Rationale for Timing
subProvisions.content: Payment frequency rationale by plan type.
items: Monthly: For high-transaction plans where participants need regular feedback and cash flow
Quarterly: Balances administrative efficiency with timely payout for quota-based plans
Annual: For long-cycle sales or strategic metrics requiring full-year assessment

tables.caption: Standard Payment Frequencies
rows: By last business day of following month

provisions.title: Data Cut-Off Requirements
provisions.content: Data finalization on 5th business day of the month following performance period.

subProvisions.title: Standard Cut-Off
subProvisions.content: All sales must be finalized in source systems (CRM, ERP) by cut-off. Finance validates revenue data. Sales Operations locks data for calculation.

subProvisions.title: Late Transactions
subProvisions.content: Transactions after cut-off included in next period's payment. No retroactive adjustments to prior period (unless error).
items: Exception: Material transactions may be included if identified before calculation begins, approved by Finance, and documented in payment memo

provisions.title: Calculation & Validation Timeline
provisions.content: Standard process timeline for monthly payment calculation.

subProvisions.title: Expedited Timeline
subProvisions.content: For critical situations, timeline may be compressed with approval from Finance and Sales Operations leadership.

provisions.title: Payment Methods
provisions.content: All incentive payments made via direct deposit to account on file for regular payroll.

subProvisions.title: Payment Statements
subProvisions.content: Participants receive electronic statement showing performance period, performance data, calculation breakdown, gross payment, taxes withheld, and net payment. Available in ICMT system/employee portal by payment date.

tables.caption: Payment Delivery Methods
rows: Separate payroll run or included in January payroll
Separate payment or next regular payroll

provisions.title: Tax Withholding
provisions.content: Incentive compensation tax withholding treatment. Taxes withheld at time of payment, not when earned.

provisions.title: Delayed Payments
provisions.content: Handling of delayed payments including notification and make-up payment requirements.

subProvisions.title: Reasons for Delay
subProvisions.content: Payments may be delayed due to various circumstances.
items: Data quality issues requiring additional validation

subProvisions.title: Notification
subProvisions.content: If payment will be delayed, participants notified by Sales Operations at least 3 business days before scheduled payment date. Notification includes: Reason, expected resolution date, contact for questions.

subProvisions.title: Expedited Make-Up Payment
subProvisions.content: Once delay is resolved, payment processed on next available payroll run or special off-cycle payment if delay is significant. Company does not pay interest on delayed payments unless required by state law.

subProvisions.title: Post-Payment Adjustments
subProvisions.content: Adjustments made in next regular payment cycle. Overpayments recovered per Overpayment Recovery Policy. Underpayments paid in next cycle or expedited payment.
items: Customer cancellations or returns (within clawback period)

subProvisions.title: Correction Process
subProvisions.content: Step-by-step process for correcting payment errors.
items: Error identified (by participant, Sales Ops, Finance, or audit)
Correction processed in next payment or expedited if material

provisions.title: State Wage Payment Law Compliance
provisions.content: Compliance with state-specific wage payment requirements for earned commissions.

subProvisions.title: Compliance Process
subProvisions.content: Ongoing process for maintaining state wage law compliance.
items: Payment timing designed to comply with most restrictive applicable state law

tables.caption: Example State Requirements (Illustrative)
rows: Next regular payday after commission is earned and amount can be reasonably ascertained
Immediately if terminated involuntarily; next payday if resigned

provisions.title: Payment Upon Termination
provisions.content: Payment timing and amount upon different types of employment termination.

subProvisions.title: Voluntary Resignation
subProvisions.content: Timing per plan terms and applicable state law (typically next regular payment date). Pro-rated through last day of employment. Completed performance periods only. No payout for in-flight opportunities (unless plan specifies otherwise).

subProvisions.title: Involuntary Termination
subProvisions.content: Timing per applicable state law. Per plan terms (may forfeit some or all unpaid incentive if terminated for cause). Pro-rated through last day worked.

subProvisions.title: Death
subProvisions.content: Within 30 days of notification. All earned incentive paid to estate/beneficiary. Payee as designated in beneficiary forms or to estate.

provisions.title: Minimum Payment Thresholds
provisions.content: Threshold: $50 per payment period for administrative efficiency.

subProvisions.title: Treatment of Below-Threshold Amounts
subProvisions.content: Amounts below threshold are carried forward.
items: Paid annually if cumulative amount remains below threshold
Paid upon termination regardless of amount

subProvisions.title: Exceptions
subProvisions.content: No minimum threshold for certain payment types.

provisions.title: Exceptions & Approvals
provisions.content: Payment timing exceptions and required approvals.

provisions.title: Roles & Responsibilities
provisions.content: Defined roles for payment timing compliance.

tables.caption: Roles & Responsibilities
rows: Calculate payouts, validate data, submit to payroll
Validate revenue data, approve calculations, manage accruals
Process payments, withhold taxes, issue statements

federalLaws: Federal Income Tax: Supplemental wage rate (22% for amounts up to $1M per year)
FICA: Social Security (6.2% up to wage base) and Medicare (1.45%, plus 0.9% additional Medicare tax for high earners)
stateLaws: California: Next regular payday after commission earned; immediately upon involuntary termination
New York: As per plan terms; next regular payday upon termination
Texas: As per plan terms; next regular payday upon termination
State wage payment laws (vary by state)
State disability and local taxes where applicable
